CatDescriptText: Miss Barbara Peterson, 1734 Cliff Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that licensed taverns are as harmful to a neighborhood as speakeasies and gambling joints? Why?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  Speakeasies are more harmful.  The average person will go home much quicker from a tavern than he will from a speakeasy.  More murders occur in speakeasies than in any other places and there is more trouble of other sorts there."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Barbara Peterson, wearing light colored coat with toggled buttons, holding cigarette, standing in front of brick wall and padlocked door
